metadata.title: CVE-2024-26911 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/buddy: Fix alloc_range() error handling code Few users have observeddisplay corruption when they boot the machine to KDE Plasma or playinggames. We have root caused the problem that whenever alloc_range() couldn'tfind the required memory blocks the function was returning SUCCESS in someof the corner cases. The right approach would be if the total allocatedsize is less than the required size, the function should return -ENOSPC.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
